Description: SWE-bench Verified evaluates an LLM’s ability to solve real software engineering issues by producing a correct patch in an existing GitHub repository. The “Verified” subset consists of tasks that have been human-validated as solvable with the provided problem statement and tests, emphasizing reliable end-to-end debugging and code changes.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning

Description: SWE-bench Multilingual extends the SWE-bench paradigm to multiple programming languages, testing whether models can generalize repository-level debugging and feature fixes beyond Python. It stresses adapting to diverse ecosystems (tooling, conventions, and APIs) while still producing a test-passing patch.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Cognitive Flexibility, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning

Description: SWE-bench Pro is a larger, more difficult software engineering benchmark designed to be more realistic and resistant to shortcut solutions, with harder tasks and broader language coverage. It tests whether a model can sustain complex, multi-step repository work under tighter constraints and higher ambiguity.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Cognitive Flexibility, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning, Self-reflection

Description: Terminal-Bench 2.0 evaluates agentic performance in a command-line environment, where the model must execute sequences of shell commands and file edits to complete real tasks. Success depends on iterative diagnosis from tool feedback (stdout/stderr), recovering from failures, and maintaining task state across steps.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Attention, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning

Description: BrowseComp measures how well models can answer questions by conducting web-style information seeking over a controlled document collection, emphasizing reproducible “browse and synthesize” behavior. It probes whether an agent can search, select relevant sources, integrate evidence, and produce a grounded final answer.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Attention, Episodic Memory, Working Memory, Language Comprehension, Language Production, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning

Description: τ2-bench evaluates interactive customer-support-like agent tasks that require multi-turn dialogue, tool/API usage, and adherence to domain policies. It stresses robust policy-following under pressure, correct action sequencing, and handling user intent while avoiding unsafe or disallowed actions.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Language Production, Planning, Decision-making, Inhibitory Control, Social Reasoning & Theory of Mind, Working Memory, Adaptive Error Correction, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition

Description: OSWorld evaluates multimodal computer-use agents on operating-system tasks that require perceiving screens and interacting through UI actions over many steps. It tests whether a model can navigate interfaces, choose correct tool actions, and recover from mistakes while tracking progress toward a goal.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Visual Attention & Eye Movements, Planning, Decision-making, Sensorimotor Coordination, Working Memory, Adaptive Error Correction, Attention

Description: ARC-AGI tests fluid reasoning by requiring models to infer abstract rules from a few grid-based input–output examples and apply them to new instances. It emphasizes novel pattern induction and compositional transformation rather than memorized knowledge.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Cognitive Flexibility, Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Spatial Representation & Mapping, Attention, Planning

Description: Vending-Bench 2 evaluates long-horizon autonomous agency in a simulated business setting, where an agent manages a vending operation over extended time (pricing, inventory, supplier interactions, and strategy). It stresses sustained coherence, goal pursuit over many decisions, and adapting plans as the environment changes.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Reward Mechanisms, Working Memory, Episodic Memory, Cognitive Timing & Predictive Modeling, Adaptive Error Correction, Self-reflection

Description: MCP-Atlas evaluates real-world tool use via the Model Context Protocol by requiring models to discover tools, invoke them correctly, handle errors, and combine results across multi-step workflows. It targets practical orchestration competence rather than single-shot Q&A.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Attention, Language Comprehension, Language Production, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning

Description: FinanceAgent assesses whether a model can perform tasks typical of an entry-level financial analyst, such as extracting facts from documents, building analyses, and producing structured deliverables. It emphasizes accurate quantitative/semantic reasoning and correct use of tools or intermediate artifacts when available.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory, Planning, Decision-making, Language Comprehension, Language Production, Adaptive Error Correction

Description: CyberGym evaluates cybersecurity agents on vulnerability discovery and exploitation-related tasks grounded in real open-source codebases and real vulnerability patterns. It probes iterative hypothesis testing (from symptoms to root cause), careful reasoning about program behavior, and robust debugging under uncertainty.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Attention, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition

Description: SpreadsheetBench measures a model’s ability to understand, edit, and compute over real-world spreadsheets, including multi-sheet structure, formulas, and formatting constraints. It emphasizes structured manipulation, consistency across related cells/tables, and iterative correction based on validation feedback.
Cognitive Functions: Working Memory, Logical Reasoning, Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Attention, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition

Description: Humanity’s Last Exam is a difficult multimodal benchmark spanning frontier academic and professional questions intended to stress broad knowledge and reasoning. It often requires integrating information from text and images and producing precise, well-justified answers under high uncertainty.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Language Production, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Multisensory Integration, Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Attention

Description: AIME 2025 evaluates mathematical problem solving using questions from a high-level competition, typically requiring multi-step derivations rather than rote calculation. It stresses maintaining intermediate states, selecting strategies, and avoiding arithmetic/logic slips across long solution chains.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Attention, Cognitive Flexibility

Description: GPQA Diamond is a high-quality subset of challenging graduate-level science multiple-choice questions designed to be hard to answer via simple retrieval. It stresses deep domain reasoning, careful elimination of distractors, and precise interpretation of technical language.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Attention, Decision-making

Description: MMMLU extends broad academic knowledge testing to multiple languages, assessing whether a model’s understanding and reasoning transfer across linguistic contexts. It probes multilingual comprehension, culturally/linguistically robust semantics, and consistent reasoning across subjects.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory, Cognitive Flexibility, Attention

Description: MMMU evaluates multimodal expert-level understanding across many disciplines, requiring models to answer questions that depend on both text and images (e.g., diagrams, plots, or technical figures). It stresses aligning visual evidence with language-based reasoning and producing coherent explanations.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Multisensory Integration, Language Comprehension, Language Production, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Attention

Description: LAB-Bench FigQA focuses on scientific figure question answering, requiring correct interpretation of complex biology research figures and associated context. It stresses extracting quantitative/relational evidence from visuals and combining it with domain knowledge to reach justified conclusions.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Attention, Logical Reasoning, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory, Language Comprehension, Language Production

Description: WebArena evaluates autonomous web agents in realistic, self-hosted web apps (e-commerce, forums, code hosting, CMS), requiring multi-step navigation and form-based actions. It stresses robust planning under partial observability, visual UI understanding, and recovery from action errors across long trajectories.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Visual Attention & Eye Movements, Planning, Decision-making, Sensorimotor Coordination, Working Memory, Adaptive Error Correction, Attention, Language Comprehension, Language Production
